meanings.definition: To gain possession of something again.
meanings.sent2: After losing his phone, he reacquired it from the lost and found.
meanings.sent3: The cat reacquired its favorite toy and proudly paraded it around the house.
meanings.sent4: The sun reacquired its strength after the passing storm.
meanings.sent5: The student reacquired her focus and aced the exam.

meanings.definition: To obtain or regain possession of something.
meanings.sent1: He reacquired the book he had lent to his friend.
meanings.sent2: The company reacquired its original building after years of leasing it out.
meanings.sent3: The magician reacquired his missing rabbit from the hat.
meanings.sent4: The athlete reacquired his winning spirit before the championship.
meanings.sent5: The explorer reacquired the treasure map and set off on a new adventure.
